page.title: 02WILDLIFE
page.content: On 11 May we did a survey from Hegglie Ber Jetty to Hoo Back.There were all kinds of flora and fauna,ranging from Daisies to Common Seals. Altogether 21 different types of animals were seen, either along the cliff edge or inland. {CLIFF EDGE We saw 82 Fulmars nesting along the cliff edge, 2 Oystercatchers on an offshore rock, 1 male and 3 female Eider ducks in the sea, 4 Shags, 2 Cormorants, 1 Common seal, 1 Rabbit, 2 Great Black Back Gulls; and Daisies. {INLAND We saw 2 Oystercatchers, 4 Arctic skuas, 7 Rabbits, 3 Hooded Crows, 2 Herring Gulls, 1 Arctic tern, House sparrows, Bees; Marsh marigolds and some Buttercups. There was also quite a lot of burnt-out heather.
